page.title: 04 Eastham - St.Marys School
page.content: The school is in the middle of {Eastham Village}opposite St.Marys Church.It is called {Eastham St.Marys {(Controlled) Primary School.}This means that the school belongs to the church but they give their permission for the Local Authority to use it. The building is mainly built from sandstone and timber.Most of the windows are very small and high up. Inside the school there is a shortage of space.For P.E. classrooms have to be cleared so that they can use the floor.There are carpets on most floors because the old floorboards splinter very easily. In all of the school there are 79 children and only 3.5 teachers. Behind the outside toilets there is a garden and play area which has been designed by the children.
